tree.name: Jarrett Allen
tree.tradeDescription: 4-team James Harden trade: Cavaliers acquired Jarrett Allen and Taurean Prince from Nets, sent Dante Exum and 2022 1st round pick (via Milwaukee) to Rockets
tree.note: Center from Texas, acquired in Harden blockbuster trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Dante Exum
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers traded Jordan Clarkson to Jazz for Dante Exum and two 2nd round picks
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard from Utah

assetsGivenUp.name: Jordan Clarkson
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers traded Isaiah Thomas, Channing Frye, and 2018 CLE 1st round pick to Lakers for Jordan Clarkson and Larry Nance Jr.
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard from Los Angeles Lakers

assetsGivenUp.name: Isaiah Thomas
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers traded Kyrie Irving to Celtics for Isaiah Thomas, Jae Crowder, Ante Zizic, and 2018 BKN 1st round pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard from Boston, part of Kyrie Irving trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Kyrie Irving
assetsGivenUp.note: Point guard drafted 1st overall by Cleveland Cavaliers

assetsGivenUp.name: Channing Frye
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Cavaliers sent Anderson Varejao and conditional 1st to Trail Blazers, Jared Cunningham and 2nd round pick to Magic for Channing Frye
assetsGivenUp.note: Stretch big from Orlando

assetsGivenUp.name: Anderson Varejao
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers sent Tony Battie, 2005 2nd round pick, and 2007 2nd round pick to Magic for Drew Gooden, Anderson Varejao, and Steven Hunter
assetsGivenUp.note: Center drafted 30th overall by Orlando Magic in 2004, acquired by Cleveland on draft night

assetsGivenUp.name: Tony Battie
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers traded Ricky Davis, Chris Mihm, Michael Stewart, and a 2nd round pick to Celtics for Tony Battie, Eric Williams, and Kedrick Brown
assetsGivenUp.note: Center from Boston Celtics

assetsGivenUp.name: Ricky Davis
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Cavaliers sent Chris Gatling to Heat, received Ricky Davis from Heat. Raptors received Don MacLean and cash from Heat, sent Zeljko Rebraca to Cavaliers
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard from Miami Heat

assetsGivenUp.name: Chris Gatling
assetsGivenUp.note: Forward signed as free agent by Cleveland. Veteran journeyman.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2005 CLE 2nd Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Cleveland's 2nd round pick, became #44 overall

assetsGivenUp.name: 2007 CLE 2nd Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Cleveland's 2nd round pick, became #54 overall (ended up with Houston)

assetsGivenUp.name: 2018 CLE 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Cavaliers' own first-round pick sent to Portland in Channing Frye trade, became #25

assetsGivenUp.name: 2018 CLE 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Cavaliers' own first-round pick, became #25 Moritz Wagner

assetsGivenUp.name: 2022 MIL 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers traded George Hill and Sam Dekker to Bucks for Matthew Dellavedova, John Henson, and a protected 1st round pick (later became unprotected 2022)
assetsGivenUp.note: Originally protected 2021 1st, protections lifted in Nov 2020 and changed to unprotected 2022

assetsGivenUp.name: George Hill
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Cavaliers sent Iman Shumpert to Kings, Jae Crowder and Derrick Rose to Jazz for George Hill (from SAC) and Rodney Hood (from UTA)
assetsGivenUp.note: Veteran guard from Sacramento Kings

assetsGivenUp.name: Iman Shumpert
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Cavaliers sent Dion Waiters to Thunder, received Iman Shumpert and J.R. Smith from Knicks and a protected 2015 1st from OKC
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard/wing from New York Knicks

assetsGivenUp.name: Dion Waiters
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard drafted 4th overall by Cleveland Cavaliers

assetsGivenUp.name: Jae Crowder
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Part of Kyrie Irving trade. Celtics sent Isaiah Thomas, Jae Crowder, Ante Zizic, and 2018 BKN 1st round pick to Cavaliers
assetsGivenUp.note: Forward from Boston, part of Kyrie Irving trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Kyrie Irving
assetsGivenUp.note: Point guard drafted 1st overall by Cleveland Cavaliers

assetsGivenUp.name: Derrick Rose
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard signed as free agent by Cleveland. 1yr/$2.1M

assetsGivenUp.name: Sam Dekker
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Cavaliers used Kyrie Irving trade exception to acquire Sam Dekker from Clippers for draft rights to Vladimir Veremeenko and cash
assetsGivenUp.note: Forward from LA Clippers, acquired using Kyrie trade exception

assetsGivenUp.name: Cash considerations
assetsGivenUp.note: Cash and draft rights to Vladimir Veremeenko sent to Clippers

tradeChain.name: Jarrett Allen
tradeChain.note: Center drafted 22nd overall by Brooklyn Nets from Texas
